name: <core_simd::vector::Simd<*const T, N> as core_simd::simd::ptr::const_ptr::SimdConstPtr>::is_null

ptr::null.doc:
Creates a null raw pointer.

 This function is equivalent to zero-initializing the pointer:
 `MaybeUninit::<*const T>::zeroed().assume_init()`.
 The resulting pointer has the address 0.

 # Examples

 ```
 use std::ptr;

 let p: *const i32 = ptr::null();
 assert!(p.is_null());
 assert_eq!(p as usize, 0); // this pointer has the address 0
 ```

core_simd::simd::cmp::eq::SimdPartialEq:.doc: Test if each element is equal to the corresponding element in `other`.
